page.title: 09ARCHAEOLOGY
page.content: The area contains no field monuments of any significance, but much of archaeological interest has been revealed by air photographs and excavations. Nothing predates the early Neolithic pottery found during excavations in 1963 in fields to the north of the A4 opposite Milehouse Farm. Air photographs have revealed 7 circles and 2 conjoined circles of indeterminate date and function at 615695. Late Iron Age and early Roman period structures were excavated in 1961-2 at 617690. Just east of this and crossing the present A4 at 618695 is a linear feature which is almost certainly the Roman road from the North gate at Silchester. The 19th century field system north of The Fishery can still be seen clearly in the air photographs. Map References are to OS SU66NW
